comment.author: 97652721@N05
comment._content: Rifleman George Barker is Buried at Serre Road Cemetery No. 1, France at Grave: II. AA. 14. (Reference: Commonwealth War Grave Commission)

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: www.cwgc.org.uk Rank:Rifleman Service No:C/12621 Date of Death:17/09/1916 Age:29 Regiment/Service:King's Royal Rifle Corps 21st Bn. Additional Information: Born at Headingley, Leeds. Son of Anny Barker, of Castle View, Grosvenor Gardens, Huby, Weeton, Leeds, and the late George Barker. The 1901 census shows the family living at 29 Cardigan Road, Headingley, Leeds. George was the second of eight children and the eldest son. No occupation is shown. Ten years later the family were still living in Cardigan Road where they occupied ten rooms. George Snr was a Commercial Traveller dealing in dried fruits, sugar & rice and his son had followed in his footsteps.
